title: LUMA v1.0 Implementation
description:
Complete implementation of LUMA v1.0 - Layout & UX Mockup Analyzer CLI tool.

This epic tracks the full implementation across 10 phases:
- Phase 1: Project Setup & Core Types
- Phase 2: Ingest Command
- Phase 3: Responsive Override System
- Phase 4: Headless Layout Engine
- Phase 5: Keyboard Flow Analysis
- Phase 6: UX Pattern Library
- Phase 7: Scoring System
- Phase 8: Self-Description Commands
- Phase 9: Report Generation
- Phase 10: Integration & Polish

Target: TypeScript CLI tool that validates UI scaffolds against spec
Timeline: 4-6 weeks (single developer, full-time)
See: IMPLEMENTATION-PLAN.md for full details

title: Phase 7: Scoring System
description:
Implement category scoring and aggregation per spec Section 8.

Deliverables:
1. Scoring Engine (src/core/scoring/)
   - categories.ts - Category score calculation
   - Pattern Fidelity: 100 - 30*MUST - 10*SHOULD
   - Flow & Reachability: 100 - 30*unreachable - 10*warn
   - Hierarchy & Grouping: 100 - 10*structural - 5*spacing
   - Responsive Behavior: penalties across viewports
   - aggregate.ts - Weighted aggregation (45%, 25%, 20%, 10%)

2. Pass/Fail Logic
   - No MUST failures
   - No critical flow errors
   - overall  85 (configurable)

3. CLI Command
   - score.command.ts - Read run folder artifacts
   - Optional --weights JSON override
   - Write score.json
   - Exit 0 (pass) or 3 (fail)

4. Tests (tests/unit/scoring/)
   - Category calculations
   - Weight application
   - Pass criteria
   - Custom weights
   - Coverage  90%

Exit: luma score works, formulas match spec
Time: 2-3 days

title: Enhance validation error messages with specific property guidance
description:
Agent feedback: Error messages like 'Invalid input' and 'none of the union members matched' don't help debug issues.

GOAL: Enhance error messages to provide specific, actionable guidance.

FILES TO MODIFY:
- src/core/ingest/error-enhancer.ts (already exists)
- src/core/ingest/validator.ts (error generation)

CURRENT ERRORS (Unhelpful):
- 'Invalid input' at '/screen/root'
- 'none of the union members matched'

DESIRED ERRORS (Actionable):
- 'Form.fields[0]: property 'type' not allowed, use 'label' instead'
- 'Button: property 'variant' not supported, use 'roleHint' instead'
- 'Table.columns: expected string array, got object array'
- 'Text: property 'content' invalid, use 'text' instead'

IMPLEMENTATION APPROACH:

1. Property Name Mapping:
   - Detect common wrong property names
   - Map to correct alternatives
   - Example: contenttext, labeltext, variantroleHint

2. Type Mismatch Details:
   - Show expected type vs received type
   - Example: 'columns: expected string[], got object[]'

3. Union Member Hints:
   - Instead of 'none matched', list valid types
   - Example: 'Expected one of: Stack, Grid, Form, Table, Text, Button'

4. Component-Specific Suggestions:
   - Maintain map of common mistakes per component
   - Suggest fixes based on error context

ERROR ENHANCEMENT MAP:
{
  'Text': {
    'content': 'Use text property instead',
    'label': 'Use text property instead',
    'fontWeight': 'Property not supported, use fontSize'
  },
  'Button': {
    'label': 'Use text property instead',
    'variant': 'Use roleHint property instead'
  },
  'Table': {
    'columns[].id': 'columns should be string array, not objects'

}

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Wrong property names suggest correct alternatives
- Union errors list valid component types
- Type mismatches show expected vs actual
- At least 10 common mistakes have specific messages

title: Add pipeline command chaining examples to AGENTS.md
description:
HIGH PRIORITY: Add command chaining examples to prevent scattered run folders and enable scoring.

PROBLEM: Each LUMA command creates a new timestamped run folder. When run separately, scoring fails because artifacts are scattered across folders.

AI agent spent 15% of dev time discovering this workaround.

LOCATION: AGENTS.md - Update workflow example section

CONTENT TO ADD:

### Running Complete Pipeline (Same Run Folder)

IMPORTANT: Chain commands so they write to the same run folder.

Windows PowerShell:
luma ingest contact.json; backtick
luma layout contact.json --viewports 320x640,768x1024; backtick
luma keyboard contact.json; backtick
luma flow contact.json --patterns Form.Basic

macOS/Linux:
luma ingest contact.json && backslash
luma layout contact.json --viewports 320x640,768x1024 && backslash
luma keyboard contact.json && backslash
luma flow contact.json --patterns Form.Basic

Then score the run:
luma score .ui/runs/<run-id>

WHY THIS MATTERS:
- Each command creates new run folder with timestamp
- Scoring requires all artifacts in same folder
- Chaining ensures sequential execution in same run

COMMON ERROR:
Error: .ui/runs/20251029-070139-805/keyboard.json not found
This means you ran commands separately. Re-run as a chain.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Windows PowerShell backtick syntax shown
- Linux/Mac && syntax shown
- Explanation of why chaining needed
- Common error documented
- Examples tested on both platforms

title: Add debugging/troubleshooting guide to AGENTS.md
description:

IMPACT: AI agents iterate multiple times on validation without understanding errors.

LOCATION: AGENTS.md - Add new section after component schemas

SECTION TITLE: Debugging Failed Validation

CONTENT TO ADD:

### If luma ingest Fails

1. Check error details:
   cat .ui/runs/<run-id>/ingest.json

2. Interpret jsonPointer:
   - /screen/root/children/3 means 4th child (0-indexed)
   - /screen/root/children/0/text means first child text property

3. Common Fixes:

Invalid union errors:
- Wrong property name or type
- Text: use text not content
- Button: use text not label
- Button: use roleHint not variant

Required property missing:
- Form needs states array with default
- Form needs at least 1 field and 1 action
- Field needs label (non-empty)
- Table needs title, columns, responsive.strategy

Invalid type:
- Table columns must be strings: [Name, Email]
- Not objects: [{key: col1, header: Name}]

### If luma score is < 85

Check individual artifacts and common issues:
- Stack padding not in spacingScale
- Touch target < 44px
- Form actions before fields
- Field missing label

### If luma keyboard Shows Wrong Tab Order

Tab order follows document order. Reorder components in scaffold JSON.

### Pattern Validation Failures

Pattern names are case-sensitive:
- Correct: Form.Basic, Table.Simple
- Wrong: form, table

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Error interpretation guide for jsonPointer
- Common error table with symptoms and fixes
- Scoring troubleshooting section

Use luma scaffold new (Pattern) when:

title: Agent Command: Core CLI skeleton
description:
CORE CLI SKELETON

SCOPE:
- Add new command `agent` to Commander registration in `src/index.ts`.
- Flags: --sections <csv>, --all (shortcut for all sections), --get <dotPath>, --list-sections, --json.
- Produce base envelope: { version: <pkg.version>, generatedAt: ISO8601, sections: {} }.
- Parse and normalize sections CSV (dedupe, preserve given order where valid).

CONTRACT:
Input: CLI flags. No scaffold dependency.
Output: Writes JSON to stdout when --json or pretty prints list of sections.
Exit codes: 0 success, 2 invalid args (unknown section or conflicting flags), 1 unexpected exception.

DONE WHEN:
1. Running `luma agent --list-sections` prints placeholder section names.
2. `--sections quick` returns envelope with sections.quick = {} (empty placeholder) not omitted.
3. Invalid section yields exit 2 with machine-readable error JSON (code/message) when --json.
4. Tests (stub) compile but may be pending.

OUT OF SCOPE: Real section assembly (later beads).

title: Agent Command: Section assemblers (quick,workflow,rules)
description:
SECTION ASSEMBLERS: quick, workflow, rules

INPUT SOURCES:
- Package version (for quick summary usage line)
- Existing CLI command metadata (workflow pipeline ordering: ingest -> layout -> keyboard -> flow -> score -> report)
- Pattern registry for rule counts (must/should totals)

OUTPUT SHAPES:
quick: { usage: string, primaryCommands: string[], recommendedOrder: string[] }
workflow: { stages: [{ name, description, command, produces }], notes: string[] }
rules: { patterns: [{ name, must: [ids...], should: [ids...] }] }

ALGORITHM NOTES:
- Deterministic ordering: patterns alphabetically by primary name.
- MUST/SHOULD IDs pulled verbatim from pattern definitions.

ACCEPTANCE:
1. `--sections rules --json` returns rules.patterns array with each pattern present.
2. `--sections quick,workflow` returns both sections only.
3. No extraneous fields (lean output).
4. Unit tests validate ordering & presence.

OUT OF SCOPE: Pattern description text or sources (handled later).

title: Agent Command: Patterns/components/examples sections
description:
SECTIONS: patterns, components, examples

patterns section:
- For each registered pattern: { name, mustIds:[...], shouldIds:[...], counts:{ must:int, should:int } }
- Compressed (no verbose rule text) to minimize tokens.

components section:
- Extract component schema names from ingest validator (data/component-schemas.json or runtime types) listing: { name, requiredProps: string[], optionalProps: string[] }.
- Exclude internal-only props.

examples section:
- Curate 2-3 canonical JSON examples (happy form, pattern failures, progressive disclosure) by reading files under /examples.
- Provide: { id: string (filename without ext), description, file: string (relative path), patternsIllustrated: string[] }

ACCEPTANCE:
1. `--sections patterns` returns counts consistent with rules section.
2. Component entry for each schema seen in existing docs.
3. Example list excludes large/raw bodies (no embedding entire JSON)  only metadata.
4. Unit tests validate pattern count coherence and example presence.

title: Agent Command: Links/meta section + output envelope
description:
SECTIONS: links, meta, envelope finalization

links section:
- Provide authoritative spec & pattern spec URLs (list of { name, url }).

meta section:
- { build?:string, nodeVersion?:string, platform?:string } if accessible without heavy cost.

Envelope shape (final):
{ version:string, generatedAt:string (ISO8601 UTC), sections: { ...selectedSections } }

RULES:
- generatedAt always UTC (use toISOString()).
- When no sections requested (edge case) still return sections:{}.
- --all equivalent to selecting every known section in deterministic canonical order.

ACCEPTANCE:
1. `--sections links,meta --json` shows only those keys.
2. `--all` returns every implemented section (present at close of epic).
3. generatedAt matches /Z$/ (UTC).
4. Unknown section list yields exit 2 earlier (not here).

OUT OF SCOPE: Git commit injection if repo state access is non-trivial (future enhancement).

title: Agent Command: Dot-path selection & filtering
description:
DOT-PATH & FILTERING

FEATURES:
- --get <path>: path grammar = section(.segment)* where segment = [A-Za-z0-9_]+ (no array indexes / wildcards in v1).
- --sections <csv>: pre-filter sections before path extraction.
- Order of operations: resolve section subset -> build those sections -> if --get provided, extract subtree -> output envelope containing only that subtree at top-level? (Design choice: return subtree standalone when --get used) DECISION: Return subtree standalone (not wrapped) when --get present for low token cost.

ERROR MODES:
- Unknown section in --sections => exit 2, JSON error { code:UNKNOWN_SECTION, section }.
- Unknown path (section missing or segment not found) => exit 2, JSON error { code:UNKNOWN_PATH, path }.
- Combination of --all with --sections => exit 2, JSON error { code:CONFLICTING_FLAGS }.

PERF: Additional overhead for path extraction < 1ms.

ACCEPTANCE:
1. `--get quick` returns quick section object directly (no envelope).
2. `--sections quick,rules --get rules` returns rules object only.
3. Invalid path yields exit 2 with correct error code.
4. Without --json flag, human readable error printed; with --json machine form.

OUT OF SCOPE: Array indexing, globbing.

title: Agent Command: Hardening (error modes, perf)
description:

ACCEPTANCE:

2. Duplicate sections input yields de-duped output.
3. Perf measurement logged in debug mode (if logger supports level) else skipped gracefully.
4. Snapshot diff across two sequential runs identical.
